text.content:
CC
New patient here to establish care.

Subjective
The patient was recently divorced and has just moved to town.  She has 2 
children who live with her.  She has several chronic problems as noted below. 
All are well controlled currently.

Diabetes mellitus type 2
The patient was diagnosed with diabetes mellitus type 2 about 3 years ago.  She 
has been overweight all her life she says and she thinks that is the cause of 
her diabetes.  However, she has had little success with dieting.  She finds 
exercising to be quite difficult given her size.  The patient took Metformin for 
a few days when she was first diagnosed but did not tolerate it.  She is 
currently well controlled on Glyburide.  She says her last HbA1c was about 7.3, 
which is about where it has been for the last 1-2 years.  The pt report that she 
has had no foot, eye or kidney problems and has no known cardiovascular disease. 
She last saw her ophthalmologist about 1 month ago and her eyes were fine; she 
was told she was not due for another eye exam until October 2010.  The patient 
denies ever having any symptomatic hypoglycemic episodes.


Hypertension
3 years ago the patient started taking Lisinopril and Chlorthalidone for 
hypertension.  Her BP has been good recently (about 120s/70s).  She denies 
light-headedness.


History of malignant neoplasm of thyroid
In 2002 the patient was diagnosed with thyroid cancer (she doesnt remember what 
type); there was no evidence of metastasis at the time she was diagnosed.  Her 
thyroid was completely removed.  She has had no recurrence.


Osteopenia
The patient had a DXA scan about 3 months ago because her doctor thought she 
should given her FH of osteoporosis.  Her DXA scan was only slightly abnormal 
(osteopenia) so she was told to take calcium and vitamin D, which she has been 
doing.


Postoperative hypothyroidism
The patient has been using levothyroxine 125 mcg daily for postoperative 
hypothyroidism.  Her TSH was last checked about 1 year ago and was normal.  She 
currently has no constipation, diarrhea, fatigue, insomnia or palpitations.


Depression
About 3 months ago the patient started Fluoxetine for depression.  It caused 
severe anxiety so she was tried on Citalopram, which also caused severe anxiety. 
She is now taking Venlafaxine 75 mg BID and her depression symptoms are very 
well controlled.  Since her divorce has been made final, she feels less stress 
over that issue as well.  She currently denies SI and HI and states she rarely 
feels depressed now.


Hyperlipidemia
The patient currently uses Simvastatin 80 mg daily for her hyperlipidemia.  Her 
LDL has been well controlled for about 1 year on this dose; she is due for 
cholesterol check today.  She is fasting (she has not taken her Glyburide yet).



Allergies
Metformin (severe nausea)
Fluoxetine (severe anxiety)
Citalopram (severe anxiety)


PMH
Hypertension
Depression
Diabetes mellitus type 2
Hyperlipidemia
Osteopenia
History of malignant neoplasm of thyroid
Postoperative hypothyroidism

PSurgHx
Thyroidectomy (complete, bilateral): 2002


FamHx
Diabetes mellitus type 2 and osteoporosis in the patients mother.


SocHx
Divorced mother of 5 (her two youngest children live with her; they are 14 and 
16-years-old).
The patient quit smoking about 6 years ago.  She drink alcohol rarely.  She 
denies use of illicit drugs.
The patient works as an administrative assistant at a law firm in town.


Review of Systems
All negative except as noted above.


Objective
VITALS:
        SBP:129, DBP:74, Pulse:79, POx:95, Temp:97.9, RR:12, Weight:258, 
Height:64, BMI:44
EXAM:
GEN: NAD, Obese female
NECK: absence of thyroid noted; no lymphadenopathy noted
HEART: RRR no M/R/G
LUNGS: CTAB no W/R/R
ABD: obese, NT, ND
EXT: no LE edema
FEET: normal monofilament test bilaterally; no abnormal lesions noted; normal DP 
pulses bilaterally
NEURO: patellar DTRs are normal bilaterally
PSYCH: normal mood and behavior

Assessment and Plan

Diabetes mellitus type 2
Assessment
Control of Diabetes mellitus type 2 is stable.
Well controlled on Glyburide 2.5 mg daily.  HbA1c within goal range (less than 
7.3) per pt report.  No h/o complications.  Normal foot exam today; normal eye 
exam last month.
Plan
Start Glyburide 2.5 mg daily today to decrease HbA1c

Hypertension
Assessment
Control of Hypertension is stable.
Goal BP is less than 130/80.  BP is within goal range today.  Tolerating 
Lisinopril and Chlorthalidone well.
Plan
Start Chlorthalidone 12.5 mg daily today to decrease SBP and DBP
Start Lisinopril 20 mg daily today to decrease DBP and SBP
Check Chem14

History of malignant neoplasm of thyroid
Assessment
Control of History of malignant neoplasm of thyroid is stable.
S/P complete thyroidectomy.  No recurrence.

Osteopenia
Assessment
Control of Osteopenia is stable.
Plan
Start Ergocalciferol 1000 units daily today to prevent  fracture
Start Calcium carbonate 500 mg q8h today to  prevent fracture

Postoperative hypothyroidism
Assessment
Control of Postoperative hypothyroidism is stable.
Appears to be well controlled on current dose of levothyroxine given lack of 
symptoms.  Patient is due for TSH.
Plan
Start Levothyroxine 125 mcg daily today to decrease TSH
Check TSH

Depression
Assessment
Control of Depression is stable.
Well controlled on Venlafaxine 75 mg BID.  PHQ-9 result is 2, which is well 
within the patients goal range of 0 to 4.
Plan
Start Venlafaxine 75 mg BID today to decrease PHQ-9

Hyperlipidemia
Assessment
Control of Hyperlipidemia is stable.
Has been well controlled on simvastatin 80 mg daily.  Due for lipid panel now.

Misc.
Plan
RTC 6 months.
text.author: PROVIDER,ONE
